required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Histological Study on Safety and Efficacy of a RF Device Flexible Applicator for Non-Invasive Lipolysis
clinical_study.official_title: Histological Study to Assess Safety and Efficacy of a Radiofrequency Device Flexible Applicator for Non-Invasive Lipolysis

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, open-labeled, non-randomized, multi-center clinical study to collect efficacy data on the TempSure FlexSure applicator for fat lipolysis.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects will attend a screening/pretreatment visit which may be performed on the same day as the treatment visit. Subjects may receive up to 5 treatments every 1-2 weeks on the abdomen or flanks.

primary_outcome.description: Photographs of the histological samples before and after the last treatment will be examined for normal structures, cell viability, vascular injury, overall morphologic traits, and any indications of the healing response. The number of samples that experience each of these histological changes compared to the baseline will be recorded. To determine whether or not the samples are expressing histological changes, a pathologist will look at the histology of each individual sample and record if they see any changes in histology (which are observable to the eye), and what they are. Then, the number of biopsy samples that express each found histological change will be counted.

arm_group.description: The TempSure FlexSure applicator will be used on the abdomen or flanks.

intervention.description: Single-arm group using the FlexSure Applicator device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A healthy male or female between the age of 18 - 55 years old.
- Willing to receive treatments with the TempSure device and are willing to have biopsies taken from a control site and the treatment area.
- Understands and accepts obligation not to receive any other procedures on the treatment area through the length of the study.
- Understands and accepts the obligation and is logistically able to be present for all visits.
- Is willing to comply with all requirements of the study and sign the informed consent document.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Is pregnant or of childbearing potential and not using medically effective birth control, or has been pregnant in the last 3 months, currently breast feeding or planning a pregnancy during the study.
- The subject is currently enrolled in an investigational drug or device trial or has received an investigational drug or been treated with an investigational device within in the area to be treated 6 months prior to entering this study.
- The subject has a cut, wound, or infected skin on the area to be treated.
- The subject is on local, oral, or systemic anesthetic agents.
- The subject has any condition or is in a situation which in the investigators opinion may put the subject at significant risk, may confound study results or may interfere significantly with the subject's participation.
- The subject is currently enrolled in an investigational drug or device trial, or has received an investigational drug or been treated with an investigational device within in the area to be treated 6 months (or at the discretion of the Investigator) prior to entering this study.
